intro: Pavonia candida, commonly known as white wood槿, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, giving them a soft texture. Pavonia candida is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands.
